member.name: N:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath
member.summary: The types and members of the Microsoft.Office.InfoPath namespace provide a core set of functionality for creating custom business logic in Microsoft Office InfoPath 2007 form templates. When deployed to Microsoft Office Forms Server 2007 or to an appropriately configured document library in Office SharePoint Server 2007, business logic created using this object model will run in both a Web browser and in Office InfoPath 2007. Optionally, you can write business logic that uses an additional level of functionality available from this object model that will run only in form templates opened for editing in Office InfoPath 2007.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType
member.summary: Specifies the editing command to be performed by the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.Copy
member.summary: Copies the selected data to the clipboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.Cut
member.summary: Removes the selected data and copies it to the clipboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the selected data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.Paste
member.summary: Copies data from the clipboard to the insertion point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XCollectionInsert
member.summary: Inserts data based on the selected context using the xCollection editing component. If current selection is within a container of the xCollection, specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then the fragmentToInsert element data is appended within that container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XCollectionInsertAfter
member.summary: Inserts data after the selected context using the xCollection editing component. If current selection is within an item of the xCollection, as specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then the fragmentToInsert element data is inserted after that item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XCollectionInsertBefore
member.summary: Inserts data before the selected context using the xCollection editing component. If current selection is within an item of the xCollection, as specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then the fragmentToInsert element data is inserted before that item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XCollectionRefreshFilter
member.summary: Refreshes the filter for the selected Repeating Table or Repeating Section control using the xCollection editing component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XCollectionRemove
member.summary: Deletes data from the selected context using the xCollection editing component. If current selection is within an item of the xCollection, as specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then that item is deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XCollectionRemoveAll
member.summary: Deletes all data contained within the selected context using the xCollection editing component. If current selection is within a container of the xCollection, as specified by the xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then this action deletes all the items within that container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XFileAttachmentAttach
member.summary: Opens the Attach File dialog box to specify the file to attach for the selected File Attachment control using the xFileAttachment editing component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XFileAttachmentOpen
member.summary: Opens the file attached to the selected File Attachment control using the xFileAttachment editing component. The form template must be configured as Full Trust for this editing command to succeed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XFileAttachmentRemove
member.summary: Removes the file attached to the selected File Attachment control using the xFileAttachment editing component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XFileAttachmentSaveAs
member.summary: Opens the Save As dialog box to specify where to save the file attached to the selected File Attachment control using the xFileAttachment editing component.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XOptionalInsert
member.summary: Inserts data based on the selected context using the xOptional editing component. If current selection is within a container of the xOptional, as specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then the fragmentToInsert element data is appended within that container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XOptionalRemove
member.summary: Deletes data from the selected context using the xOptional editing component. If current selection is within an item of the xOptional, as specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then that item is deleted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.ActionType.XReplaceReplace
member.summary: Replaces the data in the selected context using the xReplace editing component. If current selection is within an item of the xReplace, as specified by its xmlToEdit element in the .xsf, then that item is replaced by the fragmentToInsert element data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.WebServiceConnection
member.summary: Represents a connection to an XML Web service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.WebServiceConnection.Execute(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator,System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Overrides the default method inherited from the base class to allow specifying a different source of data to submit, a different location to insert the data that is returned, or a location to insert any error text returned.
member.param: An XPathNavigator object that is positioned at the XML node under which to insert the contents of the <SOAP:Body> element returned by the Web service. For a data connection configured as query operation, this overrides the declarative setting, which is the data fields (descendents of <dfs:dataFields>) of the associated object.For a data connection configured as a submit operation, this overrides the complete set of part fragment mappings.If the output parameter is specified as null for a data connection configured as a query operation, then the declarative settings are used. If the data connection is configured as a submit operation, then the returned data isn't written at all.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode
member.summary: Specifies how a form will be opened.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.Default
member.summary: The form is created or opened only if it is accessible and its version number matches the version number of the form template.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.FailOnVersionMismatch
member.summary: The form is created or opened only if it is accessible and its version number matches the version number of the form template.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.FailOnVersionOlder
member.summary: The form is created or opened if its version number is older than the version number of the form template. Since the form is opened against a more recent version of the form template, an update will occur.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.IgnoreDataConnectionsFailure
member.summary: The form is opened even if the query associated with its data connection fails to return data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.PromptIfSigned
member.summary: The form is opened and the Digital Signatures dialog box is displayed before the form's transform is applied. This only occurs when the version number of the form is older than the version number of the form template.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.ReadOnly
member.summary: The form is opened in read-only mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.TransformEvenIfSigned
member.summary: The form is opened and its transform applied, even though it has a digital signature.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.XmlFormOpenMode.UseExistingVersion
member.summary: The form is created or opened using the existing version number of the form template.

member.summary: Creates a object that contains custom error information with the specified values and adds it to the object of the form.
member.param: Sets the condition for automatic deletion of the FormError object. If set to true, the FormError object will be deleted for changes to any nodes that match the XPath expression returned by the property of this event object. If set to false, the FormError object is deleted the next time the form is validated only when the node returned by the property of this event object has been changed.
The text to be used for the short error message.
An positioned at the node that contains the data the error is associated with.
